column5: COOL Simon.... if you are allowed live minnows, give it a try.... Bass or any species can't resist them.... remember simple setup or try a spoon "william wobbler" of some sort with a jiggin rod.... just never know

Thanks for that Jacque, looks like you had an excellent season on the Mighty O.  The Ottawa River is a favorite location of mine and we try to do a musky trip up there every year in the Wendover area, but unfortunately didn't make it up this year, but will be back fer sure in 09.  Best of luck on the ice this winter.

Looks like a great year bud thanks for taking the time to put all that together.  I wouldn't mind meeting up with you on the Ottawa river this winter.  Perhaps we could have a little ice fishing get together with the members in your area.  Looking forward to your winter reports.  MTP

HELLO bud.  this is a great report man tons off spicies and frome soft and hard water..great stuff.  will see you soon at THE BAY....for pike action. . and mabe we could get hit other area for trout and whitefish this winter.  thanks to share that report..you sher did got a great year.  joco

Thanks lew.... funny you mention Wendover cause just got back from there.... tried a few hours but no bite The only thing we "whitespinnerbait aka Paul and I" got was cold feet and fingers..... man was it ever cold out on the river this afternoon    Guess Musky will have to wait til next year for me.... if you ever plan a trip down there, let me know and we could join you..... would be like a mini G2G
Thanks Mike, sure would be awesome if you could join us this winter on the Ottawa     Looking forward to your winter reports also

Thanks Marco, won't be long now if the weather holds below zero    Paul was down there this morning to check it out and the bay is frozen over but the ice is very thin..... yeah hitting other area sounds great..... never fished for whitefish before.... would be cool to try  Will see you soon down there my friend
Skunked and Starved  Brutal man.  Better luck next year.  Lol     Nice year!

Thanks SNAG    Next time I go fishing will be on hard water for sure..... Got out today for muski and man was it ever cold... you know the feeling when you don't feel your fingers anymore.... We did not get any strike
Great Report Leechman!  Bet ya can't wait to get out on the ice!
Thanks tibbs  It's driving me nuts     just can't wait

Wow...I think there are more pictures of fish in this report than I actually caught all year long!!!!  Great summary in pictures Leech.  Looking forward to seeing you ice reports in real time this winter!  Looked like you had a great year...glad you joined the board this past summer...your contributions to the board have not gone unnoticed!

Thanks Cliff for the kind words, I'm really glad I joined OFC.... best site on the planet and lots of good folks    and really enjoy the diversity of reports being posted  Now can't wait to go on ice for some pike, perch and crappie fishing on the Ottawa Leechman

Guys terribly sorry for the last post but here is my full report on fishing of the season 2008.  There lots of fish porn in that one.... hope you enjoy Will start off with hard water:  From one of our local lake... SMB      Then we move on to the Ottawa River, pike, crappie and perch in good old McLaurin Bay              [/img]                                      Now we move on to Lac St-Marie        Back to the good old Mc Bay              Fewwww..... This does it for the 2008 hard water season.... now lets move on to the soft water season  First off the Rideau Falls in Downtown Ottawa        Then from Victoria Island from shore            and now from the Rideau Falls on a boat and a good mix bag            We move to Lac St-Marie for some bassin                      And finally a pike from the Ottawa    Hope you enjoy this report Going for musky tomorrow afternoon...... wish me luck Jacques aka Leechman

Lotsa fish for you this past season Jacques! Thanks for taking the time to post that for us. I've fished the big O on many occasions and it really IS one heck of a river. Gotta try Lac Ste-Marie a time or two. Looks like a pretty nice piece of water.  Thanks again and let's see the monster you're going to get this afternoon.  Be well.
lotsa nice pics there getting me excited for ice up now
Great pictures Leechman you had some great success this year hope you get the big one this afternoon  Rob
....Good Lord there's a lot of fine eating in dem pictures.
Congrats on what looked to be a fun and productive year. Thanks for the post. Jim
Looks like you did OK, good stuff, thanks for the report...

Great report Jacques  ...some of those places look familiar  ....I was hoping to get out for some Muskie action this morning but was greeting with a surprise of ICE in front of the house!!  ....my season may be finished   ...
Yup! A very productive season for you Jacques!!!  Do you eat the Catfish or let them go?  Congratulations on some great catches!!!
Fine year Jacques.  I especially like seeing those O-river cats and nice crappie too.  Good luck on the ice in 09.... it's almost time now.

Thanks everyone for the kind words It sure  was a fun year and looking forward to hard water Good luck to all of you and play it safe on hard water   The big O has lots to offer and is the only zone that we can fish with live minnows as bait If you ever want to try Lac St-Marie, I'd be more then happy to show you some of my hot spots Now if I can only catch a musky.... it be a great way to end the softwater season   I let them go simply because I tried one once and find them too oily.... lots of fat on them.  I prefer the lake cats.... a lot smaller and very tasty

Hey Leechman....great stuff, like someone else said...thanks for taking the time to post that.  Just wondering....you got any tips for catching those smallmouths throughthe ice.?    There is a small lake next to the highway here that nobody really fishes...and it is full of BIG smallmouth....wanted to try last year but got into the whitefish to much...any advice welcome.   TY   simon
WOW what a collection of pics of your successful year.   magnifique Jacques

Thanks Simon,  All those bass were caught on a tip-up rigged with hook and minnow...... On the Ottawa river, we are allowed live minnows but anywhere else, only allowed dead frozen minnows.  Some of my buddies use jiggin rods rigged with a spoon and were catching bass. Not sure when bass season closes in Ontario, if I were you, I'd check the Ont. MNR regs for your region.  Out here in Quebec, it closes March 31st, 2009.  Jacques
Merci Brian

Congrats jaques!  yeah we had a great ice fishing year  wait till you see this year ! the gang is back together and going to do some MAD ice fishing!  did jaques mentioned he was a professinal tip-up maker??  he made the ones i have and man ARE THEY EVER light and balanced! WHAO!  great fish pron !  keep them commin !
Thanks Kevin,  Will hit the bay at first safe ice

Congrats Jacques.....  A fine year indeed , Those ice pics bring back some memories of the pike frenzies we had last winter.  Listen I know we cancelled today , because of the weather  But tomorrow its back on if you still want to get a Muskie
Memories indeed    If it's not to cold may be give it one last chance...... Will talk tomorrow
Congrats on a fine season.  Some great looking fish there.  Good luck with your muskie hunt.
Thanks Ben    If we go tomorrow.... will give it our best shot

Well it sure looks like you had a stellar harwater/softwater year of fishing !!!.  ..some very nice eyes & cats,and man do those cats ever fight hard in the ottawa river,i think because of fighting the current all the time,they are just sooooo,strong !!!!   ive been fishing the river for almost 20yrs and its awesome cause you truely never know what you are going to catch as there is just about everything that swims in the mighty ottawa !!!!....thanks for sharing   cheers
nicely done, thats gonna be hard to top in 09!

Thanks fishindevil    What you said is so true.... never know what you can catch on the Ottawa and that's what makes it real exciting    Them cats sure put up a good tussle.... the bigger ones keep bottom and use the current to it's advantage Thanks again and will be keeping an eye out for your hard water report    Thanks mepps... sure is going to be hard but will give it me best.... just can't wait for some safe ice to build and then is rock on

Thanks Jacques.   Its ok....bass season in area 5 is open all year...some size limits from November to July...but thats about it. I got some  folks upset , thinking i was breaking the regs,  responding to posts early in the season.....lol...i think they were even more upset when they realised i COULD fish for them...just kidding folks.
